original: @154b # // t'a r'a'i sngon gtsug lag khang zhig na slob dpon zla grags dang tsandra go mi gnyis cung zad 'gran skad /
analyzed: @154b # // t'a r'a'i sngon gtsug lag khang zhig na slob dpon zla grags dang tsandra go mi gnyis cung zad 'gran skad /
translated: In the past, it is said, there was a slight rivalry between the ācārya Candrakīrti and Candragomi in a certain monastery.

original: slob dpon zla grags sku 'chag pa'i tshe rgan mo cig gis bu mo bag mar gtong ba'i nor blangs pas nga la med pha gi la slongs zhes slob dpon tsan dra go mi la kha bstan no //
analyzed: slob dpon zla grags sku 'chag pa'i tshe rgan mo cig gis bu mo bag mar gtong ba'i nor blangs pas nga la med pha gi la slongs zhes slob dpon tsan dra go mi la kha bstan no //
translated: When the ācārya Candrakīrti went for a walk, an old woman asked for money to give her daughter in marriage. He said, “I don’t have it. Ask that one over there,” and pointed to the ācārya Candragomi.

original: der bslangs pas slob dpon la na bza' la ba cig dang / po ti cig min pa ci yang med bsam dgyes nas bshum skad /
analyzed: der bslangs pas slob dpon la na bza' la ba cig dang / po ti cig min pa ci yang med bsam dgyes nas bshum skad /
translated: When she asked him, he had nothing but a woolen shawl and a book. Thinking that he was pleased, he burst out laughing.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis rtsig pa'i logs la sgrol ma rgyan dang bcas pa ci bris nas ma h'a t'a ra shr'i bu ta zhes pa sgrol ma dpal chen mo la bstod pa zhes pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhi bcu pa cig mdzad pas @155a * //

translated: Then the ācārya drew Tārā with all her ornaments on the side of a wall and composed a praise in forty verses called the Mahātārāshatapūjā, “The Hundred Offerings to the Glorious Tārā.”

translated: He gave him the precious jewel worth a hundred thousand pieces that was on his foot-ornament, and satisfied him.
